Can anyone remind me why we keep the target checkpoint in the attestation data? <@291925846556540928> I remember vividly discussing this but I can't remember any arguments for it. Can you explain me them?

For context, we're thinking on reusing the index, that became useless in Electra, for something else. The target checkpoint would give us 40 extra bytes of information that we could use.
